entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin prehension-, prehensio act of seizing, from prehendere to seize get

def.dt: :a place of confinement especially for lawbreakers
:an institution (as one under state jurisdiction) for confinement of persons convicted of serious crimes compare jail
:a camp for the confinement of reasonably trustworthy prisoners usually employed on government projects
:a camp for prisoners of war or political prisoners
